title: Emrah Er
text:
I am an Assistant Professor in the Department of Economics at Ankara University.
I teach undergraduate econometrics and agricultural economics, as well as graduate research methods and causal inference.
My research focuses on agricultural and environmental economics using applied econometrics and causal inference methods.
I like reading interviews on usesthis. From time to time my friends and colleagues also ask me what hardware and software I use. Here is my current setup.

Hardware


 Computers & Displays

Mac Mini (2024)
MacBook Pro 15” (2018)
Lenovo Thinkpad T420
Samsung 37” ViewFinity S8
Dell P2314H
Dell U2414H



 Input

Apple Magic Keyboard & Trackpad
OLKB Planck Keyboard
Logitech G915 TKL
Logitech M570 Trackball
Corne 42 LP
8BitDo Retro Mechanical Keyboard - C64 Edition
MCHOSE GX87



 Audio & Other

WA7 Fireflies Amp/DAC
Sennheiser HD650
iPad Pro 10.5”
StarTech Thunderbolt 3 Dock
Flexyarm 201 PRO BLACK Monitor Arm
Flexyarm 201 PRO BLACK LAPTOP Monitor Arm

Software
My primary development environment runs on macOS, managed entirely through chezmoi for reproducible setup across machines. I live in iterm with powerlevel10k giving me a clean, information-dense prompt in my Oh My Zsh shell. R is my primary statistical environment. For editing, I bounce between Sublime Text and RStudio. I use AeroSpace for tiling window management with JankyBorders adding visual separation, and Karabiner plus Hammerspoon handle keyboard customization and automation. Firefox is my main browser with heavy UI customization through userChrome.css. For a complete list of software I use check my dotfiles.
